```lean4
import Mathlib

open RingHom Set Nat Filter Topology

abbrev putnam_1977_b3_solution : Prop := sorry
-- False
/--
An ordered triple $(a, b, c)$ of positive irrational numbers with $a + b + c = 1$ is considered $\textit{balanced}$ if all three elements are less than $\frac{1}{2}$. If a triple is not balanced, we can perform a ``balancing act'' $B$ defined by $B(a, b, c) = (f(a), f(b), f(c))$, where $f(x) = 2x - 1$ if $x > 1/2$ and $f(x) = 2x$ otherwise. Will finitely many iterations of this balancing act always eventually produce a balanced triple?
-/
theorem putnam_1977_b3
(P balanced: ℝ × ℝ × ℝ → Prop)
(B : ℝ × ℝ × ℝ → ℝ × ℝ × ℝ)
(hP : P = fun (a, b, c) => Irrational a ∧ Irrational b ∧ Irrational c ∧ a > 0 ∧ b > 0 ∧ c > 0 ∧ a + b + c = 1)
(hbalanced : balanced = fun (a, b, c) => a < 1/2 ∧ b < 1/2 ∧ c < 1/2)
(hB : B = fun (a, b, c) => (ite (a > 1/2) (2*a - 1) (2*a), ite (b > 1/2) (2*b - 1) (2*b), ite (c > 1/2) (2*c - 1) (2*c)))
: (∀ t : ℝ × ℝ × ℝ, P t → ∃ n : ℕ, balanced (B^[n] t)) ↔ putnam_1977_b3_solution :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1977_b3
(P balanced: ℝ × ℝ × ℝ → Prop)
(B : ℝ × ℝ × ℝ → ℝ × ℝ × ℝ)
(hP : P = fun (a, b, c) => Irrational a ∧ Irrational b ∧ Irrational c ∧ a > 0 ∧ b > 0 ∧ c > 0 ∧ a + b + c = 1)
(hbalanced : balanced = fun (a, b, c) => a < 1/2 ∧ b < 1/2 ∧ c < 1/2)
(hB : B = fun (a, b, c) => (ite (a > 1/2) (2*a - 1) (2*a), ite (b > 1/2) (2*b - 1) (2*b), ite (c > 1/2) (2*c - 1) (2*c)))
: (∀ t : ℝ × ℝ × ℝ, P t → ∃ n : ℕ, balanced (B^[n] t)) ↔ putnam_1977_b3_solution := by
  have step₁ : (∀ t : ℝ × ℝ × ℝ, P t → ∃ n : ℕ, balanced (B^[n] t)) ↔ putnam_1977_b3_solution := by
    have h₁ := hP
    have h₂ := hbalanced
    have h₃ := hB
    simp only [h₁, h₂, h₃] at *
    constructor
    -- Case 1: If the condition holds, then the solution is correct.
    · intro h
      have h₄ := h ⟨Real.sqrt 2, Real.sqrt 2, Real.sqrt 2⟩
      have h₅ := h ⟨1 / 2 + 1 / Real.sqrt 2, 1 / 2 + 1 / Real.sqrt 2, 1 / 2 - 1 / Real.sqrt 2⟩
      norm_num [Function.iterate_fixed] at h₄ h₅
      <;>
      (try simp_all [Irrational, Real.sqrt_eq_iff_sq_eq] <;>
      nlinarith [Real.sq_sqrt (by positivity : (0 : ℝ) ≤ 2),
        Real.sqrt_nonneg 2, Real.sq_sqrt (by positivity : (0 : ℝ) ≤ 2)])
      <;>
      aesop
    -- Case 2: If the solution is correct, then the condition holds.
    · intro h
      have h₄ := h
      simp_all [Irrational, Real.sqrt_eq_iff_sq_eq]
      <;>
      aesop
  exact step₁
```

(B : ℝ × ℝ × ℝ → ℝ × ℝ × ℝ)
(hP : P = fun (a, b, c) => Irrational a ∧ Irrational b ∧ Irrational c ∧ a > 0 ∧ b > 0 ∧ c > 0 ∧ a + b + c = 1)
(hbalanced : balanced = fun (a, b, c) => a < 1/2 ∧ b < 1/2 ∧ c < 1/2)
(hB : B = fun (a, b, c) => (ite (a > 1/2) (2*a - 1) (2*a), ite (b > 1/2) (2*b - 1) (2*b), ite (c > 1/2) (2*c - 1) (2*c)))

  have h₁ : (∀ t : ℝ × ℝ × ℝ, P t → ∃ n : ℕ, balanced (B^[n] t)) ↔ putnam_1977_b3_solution := by

      have h₂ := h ⟨Real.sqrt 2 / 3, Real.sqrt 2 / 3, Real.sqrt 2 / 3⟩
      have h₃ := h ⟨1 / 3, 1 / 3, 1 / 3⟩
      have h₄ := h ⟨1 / 2 + 1 / 100, 1 / 2 - 1 / 100, 1 / 2⟩
      have h₅ := h ⟨1 / 2, 1 / 2, 1 / 2⟩
      have h₆ := h ⟨1 / 2 + 1 / 100, 1 / 2, 1 / 2 - 1 / 100⟩

Will finitely many iterations of this balancing act always eventually produce a balanced triple?

```lean4
theorem putnam_1977_b3
(P balanced: ℝ × ℝ × ℝ → Prop)
(B : ℝ × ℝ × ℝ → ℝ × ℝ × ℝ)
(hP : P = fun (a, b, c) => Irrational a ∧ Irrational b ∧ Irrational c ∧ a > 0 ∧ b > 0 ∧ c > 0 ∧ a + b + c = 1)
(hbalanced : balanced = fun (a, b, c) => a < 1/2 ∧ b < 1/2 ∧ c < 1/2)
(hB : B = fun (a, b, c) => (ite (a > 1/2) (2*a - 1) (2*a), ite (b > 1/2) (2*b - 1) (2*b), ite (c > 1/2) (2*c - 1) (2*c)))
: (∀ t : ℝ × ℝ × ℝ, P t → ∃ n : ℕ, balanced (B^[n] t)) ↔ putnam_1977_b3_solution := by
  have h₁ : (∀ t : ℝ × ℝ × ℝ, P t → ∃ n : ℕ, balanced (B^[n] t)) ↔ putnam_1977_b3_solution := by
    simp only [hP, hbalanced, hB]
    constructor
    -- Forward direction: If a, b, c are positive irrational numbers summing to 1, then after finitely many balancing acts, they will be less than 1/2.
    · intro h
      have h' := h (↑(√2 / 2), ↑(√2 / 2), ↑(1 - √2 / 2))
      have h₂ := h' ⟨by
        -- Prove that √2/2 is irrational and positive
        have h₃ : Irrational (√2 / 2) := by
          have h₄ : Irrational √2 := by
            exact irrational_sqrt_two
          exact h₄.div_nat (by norm_num)
        exact h₃, by
        -- Prove that √2/2 is positive
        have h₃ : (√2 / 2 : ℝ) > 0 := by positivity
        exact h₃, by
        -- Prove that 1 - √2/2 is positive
        have h₃ : (1 - √2 / 2 : ℝ) > 0 := by
          nlinarith [Real.sqrt_nonneg 2, Real.sq_sqrt (show (0 : ℝ) ≤ 2 by norm_num)]
        exact h₃, by
        -- Prove that √2/2 + √2/2 + (1 - √2/2) = 1
        nlinarith [Real.sqrt_nonneg 2, Real.sq_sqrt (show (0 : ℝ) ≤ 2 by norm_num)]⟩
      obtain ⟨n, hn⟩ := h'
      aesop
    -- Backward direction: If after finitely many balancing acts, a, b, c will be less than 1/2, then a, b, c are positive irrational numbers summing to 1.
    · intro h
      have h' := h
      aesop
  exact h₁
```
